3: So this is how it is. I suppose you don't have a choice.
The way you see it, you might have made the right decision.
The crimson Punishing Virus converges on Luna unceasingly, and her frame begins to glow alight in the same fiery red.
I unlocked the last emergency clearance of the Ascension-Network, allowing me to draw on the power of the Punishing Virus.
To attempt this unchecked will damage the M.I.N.D. irrevocably.
Worst case scenario, I will destroy the data of my identity. I will lose myself.
...But it's nothing compared to my sister's safety.
Even when I've become... this, Lucia still chooses to trust me and come to my side.
The ivory Ascendant pulls herself up and graciously floats into midair. Above the Red Tide, she seems like an untainted angel.

But the red crack on Luna also slowly widens. The crumbling white frame breaks like rotten flesh, and the pieces drift away before gathering at her fingertip, turning into a crimson globe of Punishing Virus.
You could've destroyed me with the Energy Core, but you decided to bring me back instead, giving me this chance to save Lucia.
This time—it is my turn to protect her.
And then Luna raises her hand, calling upon her strength, from her distant past to the uncharted future—
